4500/A0/04/805/002.status_value: Yes.  Macro-micro simulation model to assess the potential impact of the subsidy reform on children completed and delivered to the government (released in a workshop held on 23 June 2014)  During fourth quarter of 2016 UNICEF started the support to enhance the child focus of the program's M&E system in order to monitor the reach and impact of the programme on child's health  nutrition  and education outcomes. A workshop is planned in February 2017 to review the program indicators.

4500/A0/04/804/003.status_value: SYPE 2014 has been finalized and disseminated.  A consultant was assigned to develop an adolescent profile. The profile is to provide solid analysis  statistical data and research evidence on adolescents. This data should also be linked to the existing and proposed goals and priorities of the government  the UN and other stakeholders for adolescents.  The profile will be used as policy and advocacy tool for adolescent programming.  The profile is planned to be issued in 2017.  profile based on s
4500/A0/04/804/003.indicator_name: Availability of new quality data on adolescents and youth to inform policy [disaggregated by gender  geographical location and socio-economic status]
4500/A0/04/804/003.headline: UNICEF has taken step towards the development of an Adolescent Profile comprising key dimensions of well-being such education  nutrition  health  participation and child protection. The profile will build on the analysis of existing data from national surveys and is to be completed by early 2017.

4500/A0/04/805/005.headline: In the reporting period  202 000 USD were raised for the WASH sector from corporates  including COFC of Starwood serving 1 700 households with water connections reaching 10 000 people in Upper Egypt. 223 538 USD worth of in kind contribution by 11 private sector companies in sponsorship of the Positive Parenting Campaign dissemination.
